contentrichtext.text: The '''Chicago Statement on Biblical Inerrancy''' was formulated in October 1978 by more than 200 [[Evangelicalism|evangelical]] leaders at a conference sponsored by the International Council on Biblical Inerrancy (ICBI), held in [[Chicago]]. The statement was designed to defend the position of [[Biblical inerrancy]] against a perceived trend toward [[Liberal Christianity|liberal]] conceptions of [[Bible|Scripture]]. The undersigners came from a variety of evangelical [[Christian denomination]]s, and include [[James Montgomery Boice]], [[Carl F. H. Henry]], [[Kenneth Kantzer]], [[J. I. Packer]], [[Francis Schaeffer]], and [[R. C. Sproul]]. Leading inerrantists regard the Chicago Statement as a very thorough statement of what they mean by "inerrancy". The statement elaborates on various details in Articles formed as couplets of "WE AFFIRM ..." and "WE DENY ...". Under the statement inerrancy applies only to the ''original manuscripts'' (which no longer exist, but can be inferred on the basis of extant copies), not to the copies or translations themselves. In the statement, inerrancy does ''not'' refer to a blind literal interpretation, but allows for figurative, poetic and [[Phenomenology (philosophy)|phenomenological]] language, so long as it was the ''author's intent'' to present a passage as literal or symbolic. The Chicago Statement on Biblical Inerrancy has been compared to the Vatican Council Decree ''[[Dei Verbum]]'', which expounds similar teachings for Roman Catholics.<ref>[http://www.christianitytoday.com/ct/2008/octoberweb-only/143-11.0.html?start=1 Rome's Battle for the Bible]</ref> ==See also== *[[Biblical hermeneutics]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://library.dts.edu/Pages/TL/Special/ICBI_1.pdf Chicago Statement on Biblical Inerrancy] *[http://www.churchcouncil.org/ICCP_org/Documents_ICCP/English/01_Biblical_Inerrancy_A&D.pdf Text of the Statement] {{DEFAULTSORT:Chicago Statement On Biblical Inerrancy}} [[Category:Biblical criticism]] [[Category:Christian statements of faith]] [[Category:Christian fundamentalism]] [[Category:Christian theology of the Bible]] [[Category:1978 in religion]] [[Category:1978 works]]
